speaker: SUFFOLK
line: As by your high imperial majesty

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: I had in charge at my depart for France,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: As procurator to your excellence,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: To marry Princess Margaret for your grace,

speaker: SUFFOLK

speaker: SUFFOLK

speaker: SUFFOLK

speaker: SUFFOLK

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: In sight of England and her lordly peers,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Deliver up my title in the queen

speaker: SUFFOLK

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Of that great shadow I did represent;

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: The happiest gift that ever marquess gave,

speaker: SUFFOLK
line: The fairest queen that ever king received.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Suffolk, arise. Welcome, Queen Margaret:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: I can express no kinder sign of love

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Than this kind kiss. O Lord, that lends me life,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Lend me a heart replete with thankfulness!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: For thou hast given me in this beauteous face

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: A world of earthly blessings to my soul,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: If sympathy of love unite our thoughts.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Great King of England and my gracious lord,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: The mutual conference that my mind hath had,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: By day, by night, waking and in my dreams,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: In courtly company or at my beads,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: With you, mine alder-liefest sovereign,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Makes me the bolder to salute my king

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: With ruder terms, such as my wit affords

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And over-joy of heart doth minister.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Her sight did ravish; but her grace in speech,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Her words y-clad with wisdom's majesty,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Makes me from wondering fall to weeping joys;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Such is the fulness of my heart's content.

speaker: KING HENRY VI

line: Kneeling  Long live Queen Margaret, England's

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Brave peers of England, pillars of the state,

line: And did my brother Bedford toil his wits,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Brave York, Salisbury, and victorious Warwick,

speaker: GLOUCESTER

speaker: GLOUCESTER

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Shall Henry's conquest, Bedford's vigilance,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Your deeds of war and all our counsel die?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: O peers of England, shameful is this league!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Fatal this marriage, cancelling your fame,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Blotting your names from books of memory,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Razing the characters of your renown,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Defacing monuments of conquer'd France,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Undoing all, as all had never been!

line: Nephew, what means this passionate discourse,

speaker: CARDINAL

line: For France, 'tis ours; and we will keep it still.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Ay, uncle, we will keep it, if we can;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Suffolk, the new-made duke that rules the roast,

line: Unto the poor King Reignier, whose large style

speaker: SALISBURY

speaker: SALISBURY

speaker: WARWICK
line: For grief that they are past recovery:

speaker: WARWICK
line: My sword should shed hot blood, mine eyes no tears.

speaker: WARWICK
line: Anjou and Maine! myself did win them both;

speaker: WARWICK
line: Those provinces these arms of mine did conquer:

speaker: WARWICK

speaker: WARWICK
line: Delivered up again with peaceful words?

speaker: WARWICK
line: Mort Dieu!

speaker: YORK
line: For Suffolk's duke, may he be suffocate,

line: That dims the honour of this warlike isle!

line: France should have torn and rent my very heart,

speaker: YORK
line: Before I would have yielded to this league.

speaker: YORK
line: I never read but England's kings have had

speaker: YORK
line: Large sums of gold and dowries with their wives:

speaker: YORK
line: And our King Henry gives away his own,

speaker: YORK
line: To match with her that brings no vantages.

line: A proper jest, and never heard before,

speaker: GLOUCESTER

line: She should have stayed in France and starved

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: in France, Before--

speaker: CARDINAL
line: My Lord of Gloucester, now ye grow too hot:

speaker: CARDINAL
line: It was the pleasure of my lord the King.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: My Lord of Winchester, I know your mind;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: 'Tis not my speeches that you do mislike,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Rancour will out: proud prelate, in thy face

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Lordings, farewell; and say, when I am gone,

speaker: CARDINAL
line: So, there goes our protector in a rage.

speaker: CARDINAL
line: 'Tis known to you he is mine enemy,

speaker: CARDINAL
line: Nay, more, an enemy unto you all,

speaker: CARDINAL

line: Consider, lords, he is the next of blood,

speaker: CARDINAL

line: There's reason he should be displeased at it.

speaker: CARDINAL
line: Gloucester,'

speaker: CARDINAL

line: Or more afraid to fight, than is the appellant,

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: YORK
line: The servant of this armourer, my lords.

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: First Neighbour
line: Here, neighbour Horner, I drink to you in a cup of

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: First Neighbour
line: sack: and fear not, neighbour, you shall do well enough.

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: Second Neighbour
line: And here, neighbour, here's a cup of charneco.

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: Third Neighbour
line: And here's a pot of good double beer, neighbour:

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: Third Neighbour
line: drink, and fear not your man.

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: HORNER
line: Let it come, i' faith, and I'll pledge you all; and

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: HORNER
line: a fig for Peter!

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: First 'Prentice
line: Here, Peter, I drink to thee: and be not afraid.

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: Second 'Prentice
line: Be merry, Peter, and fear not thy master: fight

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: Second 'Prentice
line: for credit of the 'prentices.

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: PETER
line: I thank you all: drink, and pray for me, I pray

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: PETER
line: you; for I think I have taken my last draught in

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: PETER
line: this world. Here, Robin, an if I die, I give thee

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: PETER
line: my apron: and, Will, thou shalt have my hammer:

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: PETER
line: and here, Tom, take all the money that I have. O

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: PETER
line: Lord bless me! I pray God! for I am never able to

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: PETER
line: deal with my master, he hath learnt me so much fence already.

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: Come, leave your drinking, and fall to blows.

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: Sirrah, what's thy name?

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: PETER
line: Peter, forsooth.

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: Peter! what more?

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: PETER
line: Thump.

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: Thump! then see thou thump thy master well.

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: HORNER
line: Masters, I am come hither, as it were, upon my man's

speaker: HORNER
line: instigation, to prove him a knave and myself an

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line: honest man: and touching the Duke of York, I will

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: HORNER
line: take my death, I never meant him any ill, nor the

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: HORNER
line: king, nor the queen: and therefore, Peter, have at

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: HORNER
line: thee with a downright blow!

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: YORK
line: Dispatch: this knave's tongue begins to double.

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: YORK
line: Sound, trumpets, alarum to the combatants!

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line: Hold, Peter, hold! I confess, I confess treason.

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: YORK
line: Take away his weapon. Fellow, thank God, and the

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: YORK
line: good wine in thy master's way.

speaker: PETER
line: O God, have I overcome mine enemy in this presence?

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: PETER
line: O Peter, thou hast prevailed in right!

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Go, take hence that traitor from our sight;

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: For his death we do perceive his guilt:

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And God in justice hath revealed to us

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line: The truth and innocence of this poor fellow,

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Which he had thought to have murder'd wrongfully.

scene: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Come, fellow, follow us for thy reward.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Thus sometimes hath the brightest day a cloud;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And after summer evermore succeeds

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Barren winter, with his wrathful nipping cold:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: So cares and joys abound, as seasons fleet.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Sirs, what's o'clock?

speaker: Servants
line: Ten, my lord.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Ten is the hour that was appointed me

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: To watch the coming of my punish'd duchess:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Uneath may she endure the flinty streets,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: To tread them with her tender-feeling feet.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Sweet Nell, ill can thy noble mind abrook

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: The abject people gazing on thy face,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: With envious looks, laughing at thy shame,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: That erst did follow thy proud chariot-wheels

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: When thou didst ride in triumph through the streets.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: But, soft! I think she comes; and I'll prepare

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: My tear-stain'd eyes to see her miseries.

speaker: Servant
line: So please your grace, we'll take her from the sheriff.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: No, stir not, for your lives; let her pass by.

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Come you, my lord, to see my open shame?

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Now thou dost penance too. Look how they gaze!

speaker: DUCHESS
line: See how the giddy multitude do point,

speaker: DUCHESS
line: And nod their heads, and throw their eyes on thee!

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Ah, Gloucester, hide thee from their hateful looks,

speaker: DUCHESS
line: And, in thy closet pent up, rue my shame,

speaker: DUCHESS
line: And ban thine enemies, both mine and thine!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Be patient, gentle Nell; forget this grief.

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Ah, Gloucester, teach me to forget myself!

speaker: DUCHESS
line: For whilst I think I am thy married wife

speaker: DUCHESS
line: And thou a prince, protector of this land,

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Methinks I should not thus be led along,

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Mail'd up in shame, with papers on my back,

speaker: DUCHESS
line: And followed with a rabble that rejoice

speaker: DUCHESS
line: To see my tears and hear my deep-fet groans.

speaker: DUCHESS
line: The ruthless flint doth cut my tender feet,

speaker: DUCHESS
line: And when I start, the envious people laugh

speaker: DUCHESS
line: And bid me be advised how I tread.

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Ah, Humphrey, can I bear this shameful yoke?

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Trow'st thou that e'er I'll look upon the world,

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Or count them happy that enjoy the sun?

speaker: DUCHESS
line: No; dark shall be my light and night my day;

speaker: DUCHESS
line: To think upon my pomp shall be my hell.

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Sometime I'll say, I am Duke Humphrey's wife,

speaker: DUCHESS
line: And he a prince and ruler of the land:

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Yet so he ruled and such a prince he was

speaker: DUCHESS
line: As he stood by whilst I, his forlorn duchess,

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Was made a wonder and a pointing-stock

speaker: DUCHESS
line: To every idle rascal follower.

speaker: DUCHESS
line: But be thou mild and blush not at my shame,

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Nor stir at nothing till the axe of death

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Hang over thee, as, sure, it shortly will;

speaker: DUCHESS
line: For Suffolk, he that can do all in all

speaker: DUCHESS
line: With her that hateth thee and hates us all,

speaker: DUCHESS
line: And York and impious Beaufort, that false priest,

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Have all limed bushes to betray thy wings,

speaker: DUCHESS
line: And, fly thou how thou canst, they'll tangle thee:

speaker: DUCHESS
line: But fear not thou, until thy foot be snared,

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Nor never seek prevention of thy foes.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Ah, Nell, forbear! thou aimest all awry;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I must offend before I be attainted;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And had I twenty times so many foes,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And each of them had twenty times their power,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: All these could not procure me any scathe,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: So long as I am loyal, true and crimeless.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Wouldst have me rescue thee from this reproach?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Why, yet thy scandal were not wiped away

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: But I in danger for the breach of law.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Thy greatest help is quiet, gentle Nell:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I pray thee, sort thy heart to patience;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: These few days' wonder will be quickly worn.

speaker: Herald
line: I summon your grace to his majesty's parliament,

speaker: Herald
line: Holden at Bury the first of this next month.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And my consent ne'er ask'd herein before!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: This is close dealing. Well, I will be there.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: My Nell, I take my leave: and, master sheriff,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Let not her penance exceed the king's commission.

speaker: Sheriff
line: An't please your grace, here my commission stays,

speaker: Sheriff
line: And Sir John Stanley is appointed now

speaker: Sheriff
line: To take her with him to the Isle of Man.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Must you, Sir John, protect my lady here?

speaker: STANLEY
line: So am I given in charge, may't please your grace.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Entreat her not the worse in that I pray

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: You use her well: the world may laugh again;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And I may live to do you kindness if

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: You do it her: and so, Sir John, farewell!

speaker: DUCHESS
line: What, gone, my lord, and bid me not farewell!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Witness my tears, I cannot stay to speak.

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Art thou gone too? all comfort go with thee!

speaker: DUCHESS
line: For none abides with me: my joy is death;

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Death, at whose name I oft have been afear'd,

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Because I wish'd this world's eternity.

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Stanley, I prithee, go, and take me hence;

speaker: DUCHESS
line: I care not whither, for I beg no favour,

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Only convey me where thou art commanded.

speaker: STANLEY
line: Why, madam, that is to the Isle of Man;

speaker: STANLEY
line: There to be used according to your state.

speaker: DUCHESS
line: That's bad enough, for I am but reproach:

speaker: DUCHESS
line: And shall I then be used reproachfully?

speaker: STANLEY
line: Like to a duchess, and Duke Humphrey's lady;

speaker: STANLEY
line: According to that state you shall be used.

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Sheriff, farewell, and better than I fare,

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Although thou hast been conduct of my shame.

speaker: Sheriff
line: It is my office; and, madam, pardon me.

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Ay, ay, farewell; thy office is discharged.

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Come, Stanley, shall we go?

speaker: STANLEY
line: Madam, your penance done, throw off this sheet,

speaker: STANLEY
line: And go we to attire you for our journey.

speaker: DUCHESS
line: My shame will not be shifted with my sheet:

speaker: DUCHESS
line: No, it will hang upon my richest robes

speaker: DUCHESS
line: And show itself, attire me how I can.

speaker: DUCHESS
line: Go, lead the way; I long to see my prison.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line: I muse my Lord of Gloucester is not come:

line: 'Tis not his wont to be the hindmost man,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line: Whate'er occasion keeps him from us now.

line: Can you not see? or will ye not observe

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: The strangeness of his alter'd countenance?

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: With what a majesty he bears himself,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line: How insolent of late he is become,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: How proud, how peremptory, and unlike himself?

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line: We know the time since he was mild and affable,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line: And if we did but glance a far-off look,

line: Immediately he was upon his knee,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line: That all the court admired him for submission:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: But meet him now, and, be it in the morn,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line: When every one will give the time of day,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line: He knits his brow and shows an angry eye,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line: And passeth by with stiff unbowed knee,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line: Disdaining duty that to us belongs.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Small curs are not regarded when they grin;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: But great men tremble when the lion roars;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And Humphrey is no little man in England.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: First note that he is near you in descent,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And should you fall, he as the next will mount.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line: Me seemeth then it is no policy,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Respecting what a rancorous mind he bears

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And his advantage following your decease,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: That he should come about your royal person

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Or be admitted to your highness' council.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: By flattery hath he won the commons' hearts,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And when he please to make commotion,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: 'Tis to be fear'd they all will follow him.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Now 'tis the spring, and weeds are shallow-rooted;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Suffer them now, and they'll o'ergrow the garden

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line: And choke the herbs for want of husbandry.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: The reverent care I bear unto my lord

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Made me collect these dangers in the duke.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: If it be fond, call it a woman's fear;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Which fear if better reasons can supplant,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: I will subscribe and say I wrong'd the duke.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: My Lord of Suffolk, Buckingham, and York,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Reprove my allegation, if you can;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Or else conclude my words effectual.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Well hath your highness seen into this duke;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line: And, had I first been put to speak my mind,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line: I think I should have told your grace's tale.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: The duchess, by his subornation,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Upon my life, began her devilish practises:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Or, if he were not privy to those faults,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Yet, by reputing of his high descent,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: As next the king he was successive heir,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And such high vaunts of his nobility,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Did instigate the bedlam brain-sick duchess

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: By wicked means to frame our sovereign's fall.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Smooth runs the water where the brook is deep;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And in his simple show he harbours treason.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: The fox barks not when he would steal the lamb.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: No, no, my sovereign; Gloucester is a man

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Unsounded yet and full of deep deceit.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: Did he not, contrary to form of law,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: Devise strange deaths for small offences done?

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: And did he not, in his protectorship,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Levy great sums of money through the realm

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: For soldiers' pay in France, and never sent it?

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: By means whereof the towns each day revolted.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Tut, these are petty faults to faults unknown.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Which time will bring to light in smooth

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Duke Humphrey.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: My lords, at once: the care you have of us,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: To mow down thorns that would annoy our foot,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Is worthy praise: but, shall I speak my conscience,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Our kinsman Gloucester is as innocent

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: From meaning treason to our royal person

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: As is the sucking lamb or harmless dove:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: The duke is virtuous, mild and too well given

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line: To dream on evil or to work my downfall.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Ah, what's more dangerous than this fond affiance!

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Seems he a dove? his feathers are but borrowed,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: For he's disposed as the hateful raven:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line: For he's inclined as is the ravenous wolf.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line: Who cannot steal a shape that means deceit?

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Take heed, my lord; the welfare of us all

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Hangs on the cutting short that fraudful man.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line: Welcome, Lord Somerset. What news from France?

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line: That all your interest in those territories

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

speaker: YORK
line: And caterpillars eat my leaves away;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: But I will remedy this gear ere long,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Or sell my title for a glorious grave.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: All happiness unto my lord the king!

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Pardon, my liege, that I have stay'd so long.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Nay, Gloucester, know that thou art come too soon,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Unless thou wert more loyal than thou art:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: I do arrest thee of high treason here.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Well, Suffolk, thou shalt not see me blush

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Nor change my countenance for this arrest:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: A heart unspotted is not easily daunted.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: The purest spring is not so free from mud

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: As I am clear from treason to my sovereign:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Who can accuse me? wherein am I guilty?

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: 'Tis thought, my lord, that you took bribes of France,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: And, being protector, stayed the soldiers' pay;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: By means whereof his highness hath lost France.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Is it but thought so? what are they that think it?

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I never robb'd the soldiers of their pay,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Nor ever had one penny bribe from France.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: So help me God, as I have watch'd the night,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Ay, night by night, in studying good for England,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: That doit that e'er I wrested from the king,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Or any groat I hoarded to my use,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Be brought against me at my trial-day!

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: No; many a pound of mine own proper store,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Because I would not tax the needy commons,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Have I disbursed to the garrisons,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And never ask'd for restitution.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: It serves you well, my lord, to say so much.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I say no more than truth, so help me God!

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: In your protectorship you did devise

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Strange tortures for offenders never heard of,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: That England was defamed by tyranny.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Why, 'tis well known that, whiles I was

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: protector,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Pity was all the fault that was in me;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: For I should melt at an offender's tears,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And lowly words were ransom for their fault.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Unless it were a bloody murderer,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Or foul felonious thief that fleeced poor passengers,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I never gave them condign punishment:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Murder indeed, that bloody sin, I tortured

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Above the felon or what trespass else.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: My lord, these faults are easy, quickly answered:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: But mightier crimes are laid unto your charge,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Whereof you cannot easily purge yourself.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: I do arrest you in his highness' name;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And here commit you to my lord cardinal

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: To keep, until your further time of trial.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: My lord of Gloucester, 'tis my special hope

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: That you will clear yourself from all suspect:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: My conscience tells me you are innocent.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Ah, gracious lord, these days are dangerous:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Virtue is choked with foul ambition

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And charity chased hence by rancour's hand;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Foul subornation is predominant

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And equity exiled your highness' land.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I know their complot is to have my life,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And if my death might make this island happy,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And prove the period of their tyranny,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I would expend it with all willingness:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: But mine is made the prologue to their play;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: For thousands more, that yet suspect no peril,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Will not conclude their plotted tragedy.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Beaufort's red sparkling eyes blab his heart's malice,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And Suffolk's cloudy brow his stormy hate;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Sharp Buckingham unburthens with his tongue

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: The envious load that lies upon his heart;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And dogged York, that reaches at the moon,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Whose overweening arm I have pluck'd back,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: By false accuse doth level at my life:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And you, my sovereign lady, with the rest,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Causeless have laid disgraces on my head,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And with your best endeavour have stirr'd up

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: My liefest liege to be mine enemy:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Ay, all you have laid your heads together--

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Myself had notice of your conventicles--

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And all to make away my guiltless life.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: I shall not want false witness to condemn me,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Nor store of treasons to augment my guilt;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: The ancient proverb will be well effected:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: 'A staff is quickly found to beat a dog.'

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: My liege, his railing is intolerable:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: If those that care to keep your royal person

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: From treason's secret knife and traitors' rage

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: Be thus upbraided, chid and rated at,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: And the offender granted scope of speech,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: 'Twill make them cool in zeal unto your grace.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Hath he not twit our sovereign lady here

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: With ignominious words, though clerkly couch'd,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: As if she had suborned some to swear

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: False allegations to o'erthrow his state?

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: But I can give the loser leave to chide.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Far truer spoke than meant: I lose, indeed;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Beshrew the winners, for they play'd me false!

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And well such losers may have leave to speak.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: He'll wrest the sense and hold us here all day:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Lord cardinal, he is your prisoner.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: Sirs, take away the duke, and guard him sure.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Ah! thus King Henry throws away his crutch

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Before his legs be firm to bear his body.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Thus is the shepherd beaten from thy side,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: And wolves are gnarling who shall gnaw thee first.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: Ah, that my fear were false! ah, that it were!

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: GLOUCESTER
line: For, good King Henry, thy decay I fear.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: My lords, what to your wisdoms seemeth best,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Do or undo, as if ourself were here.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: What, will your highness leave the parliament?

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Ay, Margaret; my heart is drown'd with grief,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Whose flood begins to flow within mine eyes,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: My body round engirt with misery,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: For what's more miserable than discontent?

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Ah, uncle Humphrey! in thy face I see

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: The map of honour, truth and loyalty:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And yet, good Humphrey, is the hour to come

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: That e'er I proved thee false or fear'd thy faith.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: What louring star now envies thy estate,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: That these great lords and Margaret our queen

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Do seek subversion of thy harmless life?

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Thou never didst them wrong, nor no man wrong;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And as the butcher takes away the calf

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And binds the wretch, and beats it when it strays,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Bearing it to the bloody slaughter-house,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Even so remorseless have they borne him hence;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And as the dam runs lowing up and down,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Looking the way her harmless young one went,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And can do nought but wail her darling's loss,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Even so myself bewails good Gloucester's case

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: With sad unhelpful tears, and with dimm'd eyes

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Look after him and cannot do him good,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: So mighty are his vowed enemies.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: His fortunes I will weep; and, 'twixt each groan

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Say 'Who's a traitor? Gloucester he is none.'

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Free lords, cold snow melts with the sun's hot beams.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Henry my lord is cold in great affairs,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Too full of foolish pity, and Gloucester's show

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Beguiles him as the mournful crocodile

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: With sorrow snares relenting passengers,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Or as the snake roll'd in a flowering bank,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: With shining chequer'd slough, doth sting a child

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: That for the beauty thinks it excellent.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Believe me, lords, were none more wise than I--

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And yet herein I judge mine own wit good--

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: This Gloucester should be quickly rid the world,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: To rid us of the fear we have of him.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: That he should die is worthy policy;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: But yet we want a colour for his death:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: 'Tis meet he be condemn'd by course of law.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: But, in my mind, that were no policy:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: The king will labour still to save his life,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: The commons haply rise, to save his life;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And yet we have but trivial argument,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: More than mistrust, that shows him worthy death.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: So that, by this, you would not have him die.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Ah, York, no man alive so fain as I!

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: 'Tis York that hath more reason for his death.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: But, my lord cardinal, and you, my Lord of Suffolk,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Say as you think, and speak it from your souls,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Were't not all one, an empty eagle were set

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: To guard the chicken from a hungry kite,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: As place Duke Humphrey for the king's protector?

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: So the poor chicken should be sure of death.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Madam, 'tis true; and were't not madness, then,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: To make the fox surveyor of the fold?

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Who being accused a crafty murderer,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: His guilt should be but idly posted over,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Because his purpose is not executed.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: No; let him die, in that he is a fox,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: By nature proved an enemy to the flock,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Before his chaps be stain'd with crimson blood,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: As Humphrey, proved by reasons, to my liege.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And do not stand on quillets how to slay him:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Be it by gins, by snares, by subtlety,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Sleeping or waking, 'tis no matter how,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: So he be dead; for that is good deceit

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Which mates him first that first intends deceit.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Thrice-noble Suffolk, 'tis resolutely spoke.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Not resolute, except so much were done;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: For things are often spoke and seldom meant:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: But that my heart accordeth with my tongue,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Seeing the deed is meritorious,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And to preserve my sovereign from his foe,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Say but the word, and I will be his priest.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: But I would have him dead, my Lord of Suffolk,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: Ere you can take due orders for a priest:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: Say you consent and censure well the deed,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: And I'll provide his executioner,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: I tender so the safety of my liege.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Here is my hand, the deed is worthy doing.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And so say I.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: And I    and now we three have spoke it,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: It skills not greatly who impugns our doom.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: Post
line: Great lords, from Ireland am I come amain,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: Post
line: To signify that rebels there are up

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: Post
line: And put the Englishmen unto the sword:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: Post
line: Send succors, lords, and stop the rage betime,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: Post
line: Before the wound do grow uncurable;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: Post
line: For, being green, there is great hope of help.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: A breach that craves a quick expedient stop!

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: What counsel give you in this weighty cause?

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: That Somerset be sent as regent thither:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: 'Tis meet that lucky ruler be employ'd;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Witness the fortune he hath had in France.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: If York, with all his far-fet policy,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: Had been the regent there instead of me,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: He never would have stay'd in France so long.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: No, not to lose it all, as thou hast done:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: I rather would have lost my life betimes

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Than bring a burthen of dishonour home

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: By staying there so long till all were lost.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Show me one scar character'd on thy skin:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Men's flesh preserved so whole do seldom win.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Nay, then, this spark will prove a raging fire,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: If wind and fuel be brought to feed it with:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: No more, good York; sweet Somerset, be still:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Thy fortune, York, hadst thou been regent there,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Might happily have proved far worse than his.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: What, worse than nought? nay, then, a shame take all!

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: And, in the number, thee that wishest shame!

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: My Lord of York, try what your fortune is.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: The uncivil kerns of Ireland are in arms

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: And temper clay with blood of Englishmen:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: To Ireland will you lead a band of men,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: Collected choicely, from each county some,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: And try your hap against the Irishmen?

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: I will, my lord, so please his majesty.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Why, our authority is his consent,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And what we do establish he confirms:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Then, noble York, take thou this task in hand.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: I am content: provide me soldiers, lords,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Whiles I take order for mine own affairs.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: A charge, Lord York, that I will see perform'd.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: But now return we to the false Duke Humphrey.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: No more of him; for I will deal with him

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: That henceforth he shall trouble us no more.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: And so break off; the day is almost spent:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: Lord Suffolk, you and I must talk of that event.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: My Lord of Suffolk, within fourteen days

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: At Bristol I expect my soldiers;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: For there I'll ship them all for Ireland.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: I'll see it truly done, my Lord of York.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Now, York, or never, steel thy fearful thoughts,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: And change misdoubt to resolution:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Be that thou hopest to be, or what thou art

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Resign to death; it is not worth the enjoying:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Let pale-faced fear keep with the mean-born man,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: And find no harbour in a royal heart.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Faster than spring-time showers comes thought

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: on thought,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: And not a thought but thinks on dignity.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: My brain more busy than the labouring spider

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Weaves tedious snares to trap mine enemies.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Well, nobles, well, 'tis politicly done,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: To send me packing with an host of men:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: I fear me you but warm the starved snake,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Who, cherish'd in your breasts, will sting

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: your hearts.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: 'Twas men I lack'd and you will give them me:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: I take it kindly; and yet be well assured

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: You put sharp weapons in a madman's hands.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Whiles I in Ireland nourish a mighty band,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: I will stir up in England some black storm

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Shall blow ten thousand souls to heaven or hell;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: And this fell tempest shall not cease to rage

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Until the golden circuit on my head,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Like to the glorious sun's transparent beams,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Do calm the fury of this mad-bred flaw.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: And, for a minister of my intent,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: I have seduced a headstrong Kentishman,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: John Cade of Ashford,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: To make commotion, as full well he can,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Under the title of John Mortimer.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: In Ireland have I seen this stubborn Cade

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Oppose himself against a troop of kerns,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: And fought so long, till that his thighs with darts

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Were almost like a sharp-quill'd porpentine;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: And, in the end being rescued, I have seen

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Him caper upright like a wild Morisco,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Shaking the bloody darts as he his bells.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Full often, like a shag-hair'd crafty kern,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Hath he conversed with the enemy,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: And undiscover'd come to me again

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: And given me notice of their villanies.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: This devil here shall be my substitute;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: For that John Mortimer, which now is dead,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: In face, in gait, in speech, he doth resemble:

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: By this I shall perceive the commons' mind,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: How they affect the house and claim of York.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Say he be taken, rack'd and tortured,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: I know no pain they can inflict upon him

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Will make him say I moved him to those arms.

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Say that he thrive, as 'tis great like he will,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: Why, then from Ireland come I with my strength

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: And reap the harvest which that rascal sow'd;

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: For Humphrey being dead, as he shall be,

scene: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.
speaker: YORK
line: And Henry put apart, the next for me.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: First Murderer
line: Run to my Lord of Suffolk; let him know

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: First Murderer
line: We have dispatch'd the duke, as he commanded.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: Second Murderer
line: O that it were to do! What have we done?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: Second Murderer
line: Didst ever hear a man so penitent?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: First Murder
line: Here comes my lord.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Now, sirs, have you dispatch'd this thing?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: First Murderer
line: Ay, my good lord, he's dead.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Why, that's well said. Go, get you to my house;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: I will reward you for this venturous deed.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: The king and all the peers are here at hand.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Have you laid fair the bed? Is all things well,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: According as I gave directions?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: First Murderer
line: 'Tis, my good lord.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Away! be gone.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Go, call our uncle to our presence straight;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Say we intend to try his grace to-day.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: If he be guilty, as 'tis published.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: I'll call him presently, my noble lord.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Lords, take your places; and, I pray you all,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Proceed no straiter 'gainst our uncle Gloucester

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Than from true evidence of good esteem

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: He be approved in practise culpable.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: God forbid any malice should prevail,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: That faultless may condemn a nobleman!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Pray God he may acquit him of suspicion!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: I thank thee, Meg; these words content me much.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: How now! why look'st thou pale? why tremblest thou?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Where is our uncle? what's the matter, Suffolk?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Dead in his bed, my lord; Gloucester is dead.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Marry, God forfend!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: God's secret judgment: I did dream to-night

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: CARDINAL
line: The duke was dumb and could not speak a word.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: How fares my lord? Help, lords! the king is dead.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: Rear up his body; wring him by the nose.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Run, go, help, help! O Henry, ope thine eyes!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: He doth revive again: madam, be patient.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: O heavenly God!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: How fares my gracious lord?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Comfort, my sovereign! gracious Henry, comfort!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: What, doth my Lord of Suffolk comfort me?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Came he right now to sing a raven's note,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Whose dismal tune bereft my vital powers;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And thinks he that the chirping of a wren,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: By crying comfort from a hollow breast,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Can chase away the first-conceived sound?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Hide not thy poison with such sugar'd words;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Lay not thy hands on me; forbear, I say;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Their touch affrights me as a serpent's sting.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Thou baleful messenger, out of my sight!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Upon thy eye-balls murderous tyranny

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Sits in grim majesty, to fright the world.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Look not upon me, for thine eyes are wounding:

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Yet do not go away: come, basilisk,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And kill the innocent gazer with thy sight;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: For in the shade of death I shall find joy;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: In life but double death, now Gloucester's dead.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Why do you rate my Lord of Suffolk thus?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Although the duke was enemy to him,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Yet he most Christian-like laments his death:

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And for myself, foe as he was to me,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Might liquid tears or heart-offending groans

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Or blood-consuming sighs recall his life,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: I would be blind with weeping, sick with groans,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Look pale as primrose with blood-drinking sighs,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And all to have the noble duke alive.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: What know I how the world may deem of me?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: For it is known we were but hollow friends:

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: It may be judged I made the duke away;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: So shall my name with slander's tongue be wounded,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And princes' courts be fill'd with my reproach.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: This get I by his death: ay me, unhappy!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: To be a queen, and crown'd with infamy!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Ah, woe is me for Gloucester, wretched man!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Be woe for me, more wretched than he is.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: What, dost thou turn away and hide thy face?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: I am no loathsome leper; look on me.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: What! art thou, like the adder, waxen deaf?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Be poisonous too and kill thy forlorn queen.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Is all thy comfort shut in Gloucester's tomb?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Why, then, dame Margaret was ne'er thy joy.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Erect his statue and worship it,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And make my image but an alehouse sign.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Was I for this nigh wreck'd upon the sea

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And twice by awkward wind from England's bank

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Drove back again unto my native clime?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: What boded this, but well forewarning wind

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Did seem to say 'Seek not a scorpion's nest,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Nor set no footing on this unkind shore'?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: What did I then, but cursed the gentle gusts

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And he that loosed them forth their brazen caves:

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And bid them blow towards England's blessed shore,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Or turn our stern upon a dreadful rock

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Yet AEolus would not be a murderer,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: But left that hateful office unto thee:

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: The pretty-vaulting sea refused to drown me,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Knowing that thou wouldst have me drown'd on shore,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: With tears as salt as sea, through thy unkindness:

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: The splitting rocks cower'd in the sinking sands

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And would not dash me with their ragged sides,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Because thy flinty heart, more hard than they,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Might in thy palace perish Margaret.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: As far as I could ken thy chalky cliffs,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: When from thy shore the tempest beat us back,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: I stood upon the hatches in the storm,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And when the dusky sky began to rob

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: My earnest-gaping sight of thy land's view,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: I took a costly jewel from my neck,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: A heart it was, bound in with diamonds,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And threw it towards thy land: the sea received it,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And so I wish'd thy body might my heart:

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And even with this I lost fair England's view

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And bid mine eyes be packing with my heart

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And call'd them blind and dusky spectacles,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: For losing ken of Albion's wished coast.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: How often have I tempted Suffolk's tongue,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: The agent of thy foul inconstancy,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: To sit and witch me, as Ascanius did

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: When he to madding Dido would unfold

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: His father's acts commenced in burning Troy!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Am I not witch'd like her? or thou not false like him?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Ay me, I can no more! die, Margaret!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: For Henry weeps that thou dost live so long.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: It is reported, mighty sovereign,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: That good Duke Humphrey traitorously is murder'd

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: By Suffolk and the Cardinal Beaufort's means.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: The commons, like an angry hive of bees

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: That want their leader, scatter up and down

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And care not who they sting in his revenge.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Myself have calm'd their spleenful mutiny,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Until they hear the order of his death.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: That he is dead, good Warwick, 'tis too true;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: But how he died God knows, not Henry:

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Enter his chamber, view his breathless corpse,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And comment then upon his sudden death.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: That shall I do, my liege. Stay, Salisbury,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: With the rude multitude till I return.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: O Thou that judgest all things, stay my thoughts,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: My thoughts, that labour to persuade my soul

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Some violent hands were laid on Humphrey's life!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: If my suspect be false, forgive me, God,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: For judgment only doth belong to thee.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Fain would I go to chafe his paly lips

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: With twenty thousand kisses, and to drain

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Upon his face an ocean of salt tears,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: To tell my love unto his dumb deaf trunk,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And with my fingers feel his hand unfeeling:

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: But all in vain are these mean obsequies;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And to survey his dead and earthly image,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: What were it but to make my sorrow greater?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Come hither, gracious sovereign, view this body.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: That is to see how deep my grave is made;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
