line: For with his soul fled all my worldly solace,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: For seeing him I see my life in death.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: As surely as my soul intends to live

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: With that dread King that took our state upon him

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: To free us from his father's wrathful curse,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: I do believe that violent hands were laid

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Upon the life of this thrice-famed duke.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: A dreadful oath, sworn with a solemn tongue!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: What instance gives Lord Warwick for his vow?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: See how the blood is settled in his face.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Oft have I seen a timely-parted ghost,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Of ashy semblance, meagre, pale and bloodless,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Being all descended to the labouring heart;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Who, in the conflict that it holds with death,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Attracts the same for aidance 'gainst the enemy;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Which with the heart there cools and ne'er returneth

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: To blush and beautify the cheek again.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: But see, his face is black and full of blood,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: His eye-balls further out than when he lived,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Staring full ghastly like a strangled man;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: His hair uprear'd, his nostrils stretched with struggling;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: His hands abroad display'd, as one that grasp'd

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And tugg'd for life and was by strength subdued:

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Look, on the sheets his hair you see, is sticking;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: His well-proportion'd beard made rough and rugged,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Like to the summer's corn by tempest lodged.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: It cannot be but he was murder'd here;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: The least of all these signs were probable.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Why, Warwick, who should do the duke to death?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Myself and Beaufort had him in protection;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And we, I hope, sir, are no murderers.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: But both of you were vow'd Duke Humphrey's foes,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And you, forsooth, had the good duke to keep:

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: 'Tis like you would not feast him like a friend;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And 'tis well seen he found an enemy.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Then you, belike, suspect these noblemen

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: As guilty of Duke Humphrey's timeless death.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Who finds the heifer dead and bleeding fresh

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And sees fast by a butcher with an axe,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: But will suspect 'twas he that made the slaughter?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Who finds the partridge in the puttock's nest,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: But may imagine how the bird was dead,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Although the kite soar with unbloodied beak?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Even so suspicious is this tragedy.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Are you the butcher, Suffolk? Where's your knife?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Is Beaufort term'd a kite? Where are his talons?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: I wear no knife to slaughter sleeping men;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: But here's a vengeful sword, rusted with ease,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: That shall be scoured in his rancorous heart

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: That slanders me with murder's crimson badge.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Say, if thou darest, proud Lord of Warwick-shire,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: That I am faulty in Duke Humphrey's death.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: What dares not Warwick, if false Suffolk dare him?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: He dares not calm his contumelious spirit

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Nor cease to be an arrogant controller,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Though Suffolk dare him twenty thousand times.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Madam, be still; with reverence may I say;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: For every word you speak in his behalf

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Is slander to your royal dignity.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Blunt-witted lord, ignoble in demeanor!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: If ever lady wrong'd her lord so much,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Thy mother took into her blameful bed

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Some stern untutor'd churl, and noble stock

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Was graft with crab-tree slip; whose fruit thou art,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And never of the Nevils' noble race.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: But that the guilt of murder bucklers thee

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And I should rob the deathsman of his fee,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Quitting thee thereby of ten thousand shames,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And that my sovereign's presence makes me mild,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: I would, false murderous coward, on thy knee

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Make thee beg pardon for thy passed speech,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And say it was thy mother that thou meant'st

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: That thou thyself was born in bastardy;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And after all this fearful homage done,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Give thee thy hire and send thy soul to hell,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Pernicious blood-sucker of sleeping men!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Thou shall be waking well I shed thy blood,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: If from this presence thou darest go with me.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Away even now, or I will drag thee hence:

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: Unworthy though thou art, I'll cope with thee

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: WARWICK
line: And do some service to Duke Humphrey's ghost.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: What stronger breastplate than a heart untainted!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Thrice is he armed that hath his quarrel just,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And he but naked, though lock'd up in steel

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Whose conscience with injustice is corrupted.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: What noise is this?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Why, how now, lords! your wrathful weapons drawn

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Here in our presence! dare you be so bold?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Why, what tumultuous clamour have we here?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: The traitorous Warwick with the men of Bury

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Set all upon me, mighty sovereign.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: To the Commons, entering  Sirs, stand apart;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: the king shall know your mind.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: Dread lord, the commons send you word by me,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: Unless Lord Suffolk straight be done to death,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: Or banished fair England's territories,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: They will by violence tear him from your palace

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: And torture him with grievous lingering death.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: They say, by him the good Duke Humphrey died;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: They say, in him they fear your highness' death;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: And mere instinct of love and loyalty,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: Free from a stubborn opposite intent,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: As being thought to contradict your liking,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: Makes them thus forward in his banishment.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: They say, in care of your most royal person,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: That if your highness should intend to sleep

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: And charge that no man should disturb your rest

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: In pain of your dislike or pain of death,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: Yet, notwithstanding such a strait edict,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: Were there a serpent seen, with forked tongue,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: That slily glided towards your majesty,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: It were but necessary you were waked,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: Lest, being suffer'd in that harmful slumber,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: The mortal worm might make the sleep eternal;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: And therefore do they cry, though you forbid,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: That they will guard you, whether you will or no,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: From such fell serpents as false Suffolk is,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: With whose envenomed and fatal sting,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: Your loving uncle, twenty times his worth,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: They say, is shamefully bereft of life.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: Commons
line: Within  An answer from the king, my

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: Commons
line: Lord of Salisbury!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: 'Tis like the commons, rude unpolish'd hinds,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Could send such message to their sovereign:

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: But you, my lord, were glad to be employ'd,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: To show how quaint an orator you are:

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: But all the honour Salisbury hath won

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Is, that he was the lord ambassador

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Sent from a sort of tinkers to the king.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: Commons
line: Within  An answer from the king, or we will all break in!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Go, Salisbury, and tell them all from me.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: I thank them for their tender loving care;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And had I not been cited so by them,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Yet did I purpose as they do entreat;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: For, sure, my thoughts do hourly prophesy

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Mischance unto my state by Suffolk's means:

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And therefore, by His majesty I swear,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Whose far unworthy deputy I am,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: He shall not breathe infection in this air

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: But three days longer, on the pain of death.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: O Henry, let me plead for gentle Suffolk!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Ungentle queen, to call him gentle Suffolk!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: No more, I say: if thou dost plead for him,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Thou wilt but add increase unto my wrath.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Had I but said, I would have kept my word,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: But when I swear, it is irrevocable.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: If, after three days' space, thou here be'st found

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: On any ground that I am ruler of,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: The world shall not be ransom for thy life.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Come, Warwick, come, good Warwick, go with me;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: I have great matters to impart to thee.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Mischance and sorrow go along with you!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Heart's discontent and sour affliction

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Be playfellows to keep you company!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: There's two of you; the devil make a third!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And threefold vengeance tend upon your steps!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Cease, gentle queen, these execrations,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And let thy Suffolk take his heavy leave.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Fie, coward woman and soft-hearted wretch!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Hast thou not spirit to curse thine enemy?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: A plague upon them! wherefore should I curse them?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Would curses kill, as doth the mandrake's groan,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: I would invent as bitter-searching terms,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: As curst, as harsh and horrible to hear,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Deliver'd strongly through my fixed teeth,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: With full as many signs of deadly hate,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: As lean-faced Envy in her loathsome cave:

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: My tongue should stumble in mine earnest words;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Mine eyes should sparkle like the beaten flint;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Mine hair be fixed on end, as one distract;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Ay, every joint should seem to curse and ban:

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And even now my burthen'd heart would break,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Should I not curse them. Poison be their drink!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Gall, worse than gall, the daintiest that they taste!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Their sweetest shade a grove of cypress trees!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Their chiefest prospect murdering basilisks!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Their softest touch as smart as lizards' sting!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Their music frightful as the serpent's hiss,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And boding screech-owls make the concert full!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: All the foul terrors in dark-seated hell--

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Enough, sweet Suffolk; thou torment'st thyself;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And these dread curses, like the sun 'gainst glass,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Or like an overcharged gun, recoil,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And turn the force of them upon thyself.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: You bade me ban, and will you bid me leave?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Now, by the ground that I am banish'd from,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Well could I curse away a winter's night,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Though standing naked on a mountain top,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Where biting cold would never let grass grow,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And think it but a minute spent in sport.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: O, let me entreat thee cease. Give me thy hand,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: That I may dew it with my mournful tears;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Nor let the rain of heaven wet this place,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: To wash away my woful monuments.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: O, could this kiss be printed in thy hand,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: That thou mightst think upon these by the seal,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Through whom a thousand sighs are breathed for thee!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: So, get thee gone, that I may know my grief;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: 'Tis but surmised whiles thou art standing by,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: As one that surfeits thinking on a want.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: I will repeal thee, or, be well assured,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Adventure to be banished myself:

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And banished I am, if but from thee.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Go; speak not to me; even now be gone.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: O, go not yet! Even thus two friends condemn'd

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Embrace and kiss and take ten thousand leaves,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Loather a hundred times to part than die.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Yet now farewell; and farewell life with thee!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Thus is poor Suffolk ten times banished;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Once by the king, and three times thrice by thee.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: 'Tis not the land I care for, wert thou thence;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: A wilderness is populous enough,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: So Suffolk had thy heavenly company:

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: For where thou art, there is the world itself,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: With every several pleasure in the world,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And where thou art not, desolation.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: I can no more: live thou to joy thy life;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Myself no joy in nought but that thou livest.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Wither goes Vaux so fast? what news, I prithee?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: VAUX
line: To signify unto his majesty

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: VAUX
line: That Cardinal Beaufort is at point of death;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: VAUX
line: For suddenly a grievous sickness took him,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: VAUX
line: That makes him gasp and stare and catch the air,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: VAUX
line: Blaspheming God and cursing men on earth.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: VAUX
line: Sometimes he talks as if Duke Humphrey's ghost

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: VAUX
line: Were by his side; sometime he calls the king,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: VAUX
line: And whispers to his pillow, as to him,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: VAUX
line: The secrets of his overcharged soul;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: VAUX
line: And I am sent to tell his majesty

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: VAUX
line: That even now he cries aloud for him.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Go tell this heavy message to the king.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Ay me! what is this world! what news are these!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: But wherefore grieve I at an hour's poor loss,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Omitting Suffolk's exile, my soul's treasure?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Why only, Suffolk, mourn I not for thee,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And with the southern clouds contend in tears,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Theirs for the earth's increase, mine for my sorrows?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Now get thee hence: the king, thou know'st, is coming;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: If thou be found by me, thou art but dead.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: If I depart from thee, I cannot live;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And in thy sight to die, what were it else

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: But like a pleasant slumber in thy lap?

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Here could I breathe my soul into the air,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: As mild and gentle as the cradle-babe

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Dying with mother's dug between its lips:

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Where, from thy sight, I should be raging mad,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And cry out for thee to close up mine eyes,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: To have thee with thy lips to stop my mouth;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: So shouldst thou either turn my flying soul,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Or I should breathe it so into thy body,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: And then it lived in sweet Elysium.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: To die by thee were but to die in jest;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: From thee to die were torture more than death:

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: O, let me stay, befall what may befall!

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Away! though parting be a fretful corrosive,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: It is applied to a deathful wound.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: To France, sweet Suffolk: let me hear from thee;

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: For wheresoe'er thou art in this world's globe,

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: I'll have an Iris that shall find thee out.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: I go.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And take my heart with thee.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: A jewel, lock'd into the wofull'st cask

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: That ever did contain a thing of worth.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: Even as a splitted bark, so sunder we

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: SUFFOLK
line: This way fall I to death.

scene: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: This way for me.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: How fares my lord? speak, Beaufort, to

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: thy sovereign.

speaker: CARDINAL
line: If thou be'st death, I'll give thee England's treasure,

speaker: CARDINAL
line: Enough to purchase such another island,

speaker: CARDINAL
line: So thou wilt let me live, and feel no pain.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Ah, what a sign it is of evil life,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Where death's approach is seen so terrible!

speaker: WARWICK
line: Beaufort, it is thy sovereign speaks to thee.

speaker: CARDINAL
line: Bring me unto my trial when you will.

speaker: CARDINAL
line: Died he not in his bed? where should he die?

speaker: CARDINAL
line: Can I make men live, whether they will or no?

speaker: CARDINAL
line: O, torture me no more! I will confess.

speaker: CARDINAL
line: Alive again? then show me where he is:

speaker: CARDINAL
line: I'll give a thousand pound to look upon him.

speaker: CARDINAL
line: He hath no eyes, the dust hath blinded them.

speaker: CARDINAL
line: Comb down his hair; look, look! it stands upright,

speaker: CARDINAL
line: Like lime-twigs set to catch my winged soul.

speaker: CARDINAL
line: Give me some drink; and bid the apothecary

speaker: CARDINAL
line: Bring the strong poison that I bought of him.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: O thou eternal Mover of the heavens.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Look with a gentle eye upon this wretch!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: O, beat away the busy meddling fiend

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: That lays strong siege unto this wretch's soul.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And from his bosom purge this black despair!

speaker: WARWICK
line: See, how the pangs of death do make him grin!

speaker: SALISBURY
line: Disturb him not; let him pass peaceably.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Peace to his soul, if God's good pleasure be!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Lord cardinal, if thou think'st on heaven's bliss,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Hold up thy hand, make signal of thy hope.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: He dies, and makes no sign. O God, forgive him!

speaker: WARWICK
line: So bad a death argues a monstrous life.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Forbear to judge, for we are sinners all.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Close up his eyes and draw the curtain close;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And let us all to meditation.

scene: SCENE I.  The coast of Kent.
speaker: Captain
line: The gaudy, blabbing and remorseful day

scene: SCENE I.  The coast of Kent.
speaker: Captain
line: Is crept into the bosom of the sea;

scene: SCENE I.  The coast of Kent.
speaker: Captain
line: And now loud-howling wolves arouse the jades

scene: SCENE I.  The coast of Kent.
speaker: Captain
line: That drag the tragic melancholy night;

scene: SCENE I.  The coast of Kent.
speaker: Captain
line: Who, with their drowsy, slow and flagging wings,

scene: SCENE I.  The coast of Kent.
speaker: Captain
line: Clip dead men's graves and from their misty jaws

scene: SCENE I.  The coast of Kent.
speaker: Captain
line: Breathe foul contagious darkness in the air.

scene: SCENE I.  The coast of Kent.
speaker: Captain
line: Therefore bring forth the soldiers of our prize;

scene: SCENE I.  The coast of Kent.
speaker: Captain
line: For, whilst our pinnace anchors in the Downs,

scene: SCENE I.  The coast of Kent.
speaker: Captain
line: Here shall they make their ransom on the sand,

line: Or is he but retired to make him strong?

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: He is fled, my lord, and all his powers do yield;

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: And humbly thus, with halters on their necks,

speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Expect your highness' doom of life or death.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Then, heaven, set ope thy everlasting gates,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: To entertain my vows of thanks and praise!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Soldiers, this day have you redeemed your lives,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And show'd how well you love your prince and country:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Continue still in this so good a mind,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And Henry, though he be infortunate,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Assure yourselves, will never be unkind:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And so, with thanks and pardon to you all,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: I do dismiss you to your several countries.

speaker: ALL
line: God save the king! God save the king!

speaker: Messenger
line: Please it your grace to be advertised

speaker: Messenger
line: The Duke of York is newly come from Ireland,

speaker: Messenger
line: And with a puissant and a mighty power

speaker: Messenger
line: Of gallowglasses and stout kerns

speaker: Messenger
line: Is marching hitherward in proud array,

speaker: Messenger
line: And still proclaimeth, as he comes along,

speaker: Messenger
line: His arms are only to remove from thee

speaker: Messenger
line: The Duke of Somerset, whom he terms traitor.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Thus stands my state, 'twixt Cade and York distress'd.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Like to a ship that, having 'scaped a tempest,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Is straightway calm'd and boarded with a pirate:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: But now is Cade driven back, his men dispersed;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And now is York in arms to second him.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: I pray thee, Buckingham, go and meet him,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And ask him what's the reason of these arms.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Tell him I'll send Duke Edmund to the Tower;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And, Somerset, we'll commit thee thither,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Until his army be dismiss'd from him.

speaker: SOMERSET
line: My lord,

speaker: SOMERSET
line: I'll yield myself to prison willingly,

speaker: SOMERSET
line: Or unto death, to do my country good.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: In any case, be not too rough in terms;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: For he is fierce and cannot brook hard language.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: I will, my lord; and doubt not so to deal

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: As all things shall redound unto your good.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Come, wife, let's in, and learn to govern better;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: For yet may England curse my wretched reign.

speaker: CADE
line: Fie on ambition! fie on myself, that have a sword,

speaker: CADE
line: and yet am ready to famish! These five days have I

speaker: CADE
line: hid me in these woods and durst not peep out, for

speaker: CADE
line: all the country is laid for me; but now am I so

speaker: CADE
line: hungry that if I might have a lease of my life for a

speaker: CADE
line: thousand years I could stay no longer. Wherefore,

speaker: CADE
line: on a brick wall have I climbed into this garden, to

speaker: CADE
line: see if I can eat grass, or pick a sallet another

speaker: CADE
line: while, which is not amiss to cool a man's stomach

speaker: CADE
line: this hot weather. And I think this word 'sallet'

speaker: CADE
line: was born to do me good: for many a time, but for a

speaker: CADE
line: sallet, my brainpan had been cleft with a brown

speaker: CADE
line: bill; and many a time, when I have been dry and

speaker: CADE
line: bravely marching, it hath served me instead of a

speaker: CADE
line: quart pot to drink in; and now the word 'sallet'

speaker: CADE
line: must serve me to feed on.

speaker: IDEN
line: Lord, who would live turmoiled in the court,

speaker: IDEN
line: And may enjoy such quiet walks as these?

speaker: IDEN
line: This small inheritance my father left me

speaker: IDEN
line: Contenteth me, and worth a monarchy.

speaker: IDEN
line: I seek not to wax great by others' waning,

speaker: IDEN
line: Or gather wealth, I care not, with what envy:

speaker: IDEN
line: Sufficeth that I have maintains my state

speaker: IDEN
line: And sends the poor well pleased from my gate.

speaker: CADE
line: Here's the lord of the soil come to seize me for a

speaker: CADE
line: stray, for entering his fee-simple without leave.

speaker: CADE
line: Ah, villain, thou wilt betray me, and get a thousand

speaker: CADE
line: crowns of the king carrying my head to him: but

speaker: CADE
line: I'll make thee eat iron like an ostrich, and swallow

speaker: CADE
line: my sword like a great pin, ere thou and I part.

speaker: IDEN
line: Why, rude companion, whatsoe'er thou be,

speaker: IDEN
line: I know thee not; why, then, should I betray thee?

speaker: IDEN
line: Is't not enough to break into my garden,

speaker: IDEN
line: And, like a thief, to come to rob my grounds,

speaker: IDEN
line: Climbing my walls in spite of me the owner,

speaker: IDEN
line: But thou wilt brave me with these saucy terms?

speaker: CADE
line: Brave thee! ay, by the best blood that ever was

speaker: CADE
line: broached, and beard thee too. Look on me well: I

speaker: CADE
line: have eat no meat these five days; yet, come thou and

speaker: CADE
line: thy five men, and if I do not leave you all as dead

speaker: CADE
line: as a doornail, I pray God I may never eat grass more.

speaker: IDEN
line: Nay, it shall ne'er be said, while England stands,

speaker: IDEN
line: That Alexander Iden, an esquire of Kent,

speaker: IDEN
line: Took odds to combat a poor famish'd man.

speaker: IDEN
line: Oppose thy steadfast-gazing eyes to mine,

speaker: IDEN
line: See if thou canst outface me with thy looks:

speaker: IDEN
line: Set limb to limb, and thou art far the lesser;

speaker: IDEN
line: Thy hand is but a finger to my fist,

speaker: IDEN
line: Thy leg a stick compared with this truncheon;

speaker: IDEN
line: My foot shall fight with all the strength thou hast;

speaker: IDEN
line: And if mine arm be heaved in the air,

speaker: IDEN
line: Thy grave is digg'd already in the earth.

speaker: IDEN
line: As for words, whose greatness answers words,

speaker: IDEN
line: Let this my sword report what speech forbears.

speaker: CADE
line: By my valour, the most complete champion that ever I

speaker: CADE
line: heard! Steel, if thou turn the edge, or cut not out

speaker: CADE
line: the burly-boned clown in chines of beef ere thou

speaker: CADE
line: sleep in thy sheath, I beseech God on my knees thou

speaker: CADE
line: mayst be turned to hobnails.

speaker: CADE
line: O, I am slain! famine and no other hath slain me:

speaker: CADE
line: let ten thousand devils come against me, and give me

speaker: CADE
line: but the ten meals I have lost, and I'll defy them

speaker: CADE
line: all. Wither, garden; and be henceforth a

speaker: CADE
line: burying-place to all that do dwell in this house,

speaker: CADE
line: because the unconquered soul of Cade is fled.

speaker: IDEN
line: Is't Cade that I have slain, that monstrous traitor?

speaker: IDEN
line: Sword, I will hollow thee for this thy deed,

speaker: IDEN
line: And hang thee o'er my tomb when I am dead:

speaker: IDEN
line: Ne'er shall this blood be wiped from thy point;

speaker: IDEN
line: But thou shalt wear it as a herald's coat,

speaker: IDEN
line: To emblaze the honour that thy master got.

speaker: CADE
line: Iden, farewell, and be proud of thy victory. Tell

speaker: CADE
line: Kent from me, she hath lost her best man, and exhort

speaker: CADE
line: all the world to be cowards; for I, that never

speaker: CADE
line: feared any, am vanquished by famine, not by valour.

speaker: IDEN
line: How much thou wrong'st me, heaven be my judge.

speaker: IDEN
line: Die, damned wretch, the curse of her that bare thee;

speaker: IDEN
line: And as I thrust thy body in with my sword,

speaker: IDEN
line: So wish I, I might thrust thy soul to hell.

speaker: IDEN
line: Hence will I drag thee headlong by the heels

speaker: IDEN
line: Unto a dunghill which shall be thy grave,

speaker: IDEN
line: And there cut off thy most ungracious head;

speaker: IDEN
line: Which I will bear in triumph to the king,

speaker: IDEN
line: Leaving thy trunk for crows to feed upon.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: From Ireland thus comes York to claim his right,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: And pluck the crown from feeble Henry's head:

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Ring, bells, aloud; burn, bonfires, clear and bright,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: To entertain great England's lawful king.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Ah! sancta majestas, who would not buy thee dear?

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Let them obey that know not how to rule;

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: This hand was made to handle naught but gold.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: I cannot give due action to my words,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Except a sword or sceptre balance it:

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: A sceptre shall it have, have I a soul,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: On which I'll toss the flower-de-luce of France.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Whom have we here? Buckingham, to disturb me?

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: The king hath sent him, sure: I must dissemble.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: York, if thou meanest well, I greet thee well.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Humphrey of Buckingham, I accept thy greeting.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Art thou a messenger, or come of pleasure?

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: A messenger from Henry, our dread liege,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: To know the reason of these arms in peace;

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Or why thou, being a subject as I am,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Against thy oath and true allegiance sworn,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Should raise so great a power without his leave,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Or dare to bring thy force so near the court.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Aside  Scarce can I speak, my choler is so great:

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: O, I could hew up rocks and fight with flint,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: I am so angry at these abject terms;

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: And now, like Ajax Telamonius,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: On sheep or oxen could I spend my fury.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: I am far better born than is the king,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: More like a king, more kingly in my thoughts:

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: But I must make fair weather yet a while,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Till Henry be more weak and I more strong,--

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Buckingham, I prithee, pardon me,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: That I have given no answer all this while;

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: My mind was troubled with deep melancholy.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: The cause why I have brought this army hither

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Is to remove proud Somerset from the king,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Seditious to his grace and to the state.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: That is too much presumption on thy part:

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: But if thy arms be to no other end,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: The king hath yielded unto thy demand:

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: The Duke of Somerset is in the Tower.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Upon thine honour, is he prisoner?

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Upon mine honour, he is prisoner.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Then, Buckingham, I do dismiss my powers.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Soldiers, I thank you all; disperse yourselves;

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Meet me to-morrow in St. George's field,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: You shall have pay and every thing you wish.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: And let my sovereign, virtuous Henry,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Command my eldest son, nay, all my sons,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: As pledges of my fealty and love;

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: I'll send them all as willing as I live:

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Lands, goods, horse, armour, any thing I have,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Is his to use, so Somerset may die.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: York, I commend this kind submission:

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: We twain will go into his highness' tent.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Buckingham, doth York intend no harm to us,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: That thus he marcheth with thee arm in arm?

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: In all submission and humility

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: York doth present himself unto your highness.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Then what intends these forces thou dost bring?

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: To heave the traitor Somerset from hence,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: And fight against that monstrous rebel Cade,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Who since I heard to be discomfited.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: IDEN
line: If one so rude and of so mean condition

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: IDEN
line: May pass into the presence of a king,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: IDEN
line: Lo, I present your grace a traitor's head,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: IDEN
line: The head of Cade, whom I in combat slew.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: The head of Cade! Great God, how just art Thou!

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: O, let me view his visage, being dead,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: That living wrought me such exceeding trouble.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Tell me, my friend, art thou the man that slew him?

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: IDEN
line: I was, an't like your majesty.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: How art thou call'd? and what is thy degree?

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: IDEN
line: Alexander Iden, that's my name;

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: IDEN
line: A poor esquire of Kent, that loves his king.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: So please it you, my lord, 'twere not amiss

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: He were created knight for his good service.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Iden, kneel down.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Rise up a knight.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: We give thee for reward a thousand marks,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: And will that thou henceforth attend on us.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: IDEN
line: May Iden live to merit such a bounty.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: IDEN
line: And never live but true unto his liege!

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: See, Buckingham, Somerset comes with the queen:

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: KING HENRY VI
line: Go, bid her hide him quickly from the duke.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: For thousand Yorks he shall not hide his head,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: But boldly stand and front him to his face.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: How now! is Somerset at liberty?

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Then, York, unloose thy long-imprison'd thoughts,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: And let thy tongue be equal with thy heart.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Shall I endure the sight of Somerset?

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: False king! why hast thou broken faith with me,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Knowing how hardly I can brook abuse?

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: King did I call thee? no, thou art not king,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Not fit to govern and rule multitudes,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Which darest not, no, nor canst not rule a traitor.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: That head of thine doth not become a crown;

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Thy hand is made to grasp a palmer's staff,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: And not to grace an awful princely sceptre.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: That gold must round engirt these brows of mine,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Whose smile and frown, like to Achilles' spear,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Is able with the change to kill and cure.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Here is a hand to hold a sceptre up

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: And with the same to act controlling laws.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Give place: by heaven, thou shalt rule no more

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: O'er him whom heaven created for thy ruler.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: O monstrous traitor! I arrest thee, York,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: Of capital treason 'gainst the king and crown;

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: SOMERSET
line: Obey, audacious traitor; kneel for grace.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Wouldst have me kneel? first let me ask of these,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: If they can brook I bow a knee to man.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Sirrah, call in my sons to be my bail;

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: I know, ere they will have me go to ward,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: They'll pawn their swords for my enfranchisement.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Call hither Clifford! bid him come amain,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: To say if that the bastard boys of York

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: Shall be the surety for their traitor father.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: O blood-besotted Neapolitan,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Outcast of Naples, England's bloody scourge!

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: The sons of York, thy betters in their birth,

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Shall be their father's bail; and bane to those

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: That for my surety will refuse the boys!

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: See where they come: I'll warrant they'll

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: make it good.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
line: And here comes Clifford to deny their bail.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: Health and all happiness to my lord the king!

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: I thank thee, Clifford: say, what news with thee?

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: Nay, do not fright us with an angry look;

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: We are thy sovereign, Clifford, kneel again;

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: YORK
line: For thy mistaking so, we pardon thee.

scene: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.
speaker: CLIFFORD
line: This is my king, York, I do not mistake;
